intro: Streptocarpus × banksii, commonly known as the hybrid streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with trailing stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Streptocarpus × banksii is popular among gardeners for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
